Description: East Greek pottery lamp. Wheel-made with a wide sloping rim, a raised edge round the filling-orifice, and a short raised tubular nozzle. The base is slightly concave. A mark is incised on the rim. Decorated with bands of orange to brown glaze. Orange-pink fabric with frequent fine mica, black and white inclusions
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AΠ5 (top level of 'bothros' / 'trench with bowls')
Curator's comments: Bailey attributed this piece, based on a parallel, to Rhodes (Bailey 1975, 170), but in the addenda published in Lamps III, 450, suggests Smryna on the strength of a parallel found there.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q374)
Walters 1914 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Lamps in the British Museum (179)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KC.16) (Phase 1)
